intro: Antirhea acutata subsp. elliptica, commonly known as the elliptical antirhea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
